feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued November 12 at 3:38PM AKST until November 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches with up to 12 inches on the Anchorage and Eagle River Hillsides. Areas of blowing snow reducing visibilities to one half mile or less at times Monday morning.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 4:22AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FRONTAL SYSTEM TO BRING TRANSITIONS BETWEEN SNOW, RAIN, AND FREEZING RAIN TODAY... A front will begin to push inland across Southwest Alaska this morning bringing with it warmer air. Initial snow is forecast to transition to a rain/freezing rain mix as a result of the warmer air pushing atop at or sub-freezing surface temperatures. While

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 2:54AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Confidence Continues to Increase for Snowfall Sunday Night through Thursday... A strong frontal boundary is expected to bring snowy conditions for most of the Interior Sunday night and into Monday. Widespread snowfall of 2 to 5 inches possible with locally heavier amounts of 5 to 7 inches west of Fairbanks through Tuesday. Gusty west winds
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 2:52AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Expected Monday Through Tuesday... A strong storm moving through the Chukchi Sea Sunday into Monday will push a surge of water into the northwest Arctic Coast. Persistent south to southwest winds 20 to 30 mph will develop across the Chukchi Sea and result in elevated water levels 1 to 2 feet above the normal high tide line Monday through Tuesday. The
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 12 at 7:28PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Melbourne FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The river is forecast to increase into Minor Flood Stage late tonight and remain in Flood stage until early Tuesday morning due to the moderate northerly wind.
